result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Lamont Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.
Court ordered defendant's operating privileges revoked for 3 YEARS with the mandatory reinstatement fee.

Defendant's operating privilege for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device; and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of 3 YEARS thereafter.
Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment; form filed; copy to defendant.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $2400.00 inclusive of all court costs.
Pay DNA surcharges.
Pay costs associated with Ignition interlock and reinstatement fees.
- Cash bail on deposit to be applied as follows:  pay WCS costs, DNA surcharges, ignition interlock costs and fine.
-  If defendant is revoked, Court ordered that costs, fines, surcharges  be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Cooperate with Probation Department.
Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
Random urine screens.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

timeConds.notes: with huber for work and treatment with 2 days credit.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason Lamont Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order denying defendant's request for electronic monitoring, signed and filed.
Letter from defendant about house arrset.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Dennis R. Cimpl, Br. 19, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for release on electronic monitoring.

Defendant Jason Lamont Smith in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions, elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3 YEARS CONSECUTIVEto any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1.5 YEARS.
Court stayed the sentence and placed the defendant on 18 months probation
Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Probation or Extended Supervision if revoked:
- Condition time of 9 months with huber for work and treatment with 2 days credit
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment; form filed; copy to defendant.
Court ordered defendant's operating privileges revoked for 3 YEARS with the mandatory reinstatement fee.  
Defendant's operating privilege for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device; and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of 3 YEARS thereafter.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $2400.00 inclusive of all court costs; 
Pay DNA surcharges; pay costs associated with Ignition interlock and reinstatement fees

-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied as follows:  pay WCS costs, DNA surcharges, ignition interlock costs and fine.
-  If defendant is revoked, Court ordered that costs, fines, surcharges  be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Letters on behalf of the defendant

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Jason Lamont Smith in court with Attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviews WCS report with the defendant; due to defendant's compliance with monitoring, Court will grant adjournment and orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 19.

Defendant Jason Lamont Smith in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests, portable breathalyzers, and SCRAM.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jason Lamont Smith in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Jason Lamont Smith in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
